question:
Bag A cotais thee white balls ad fou ed balls. Two balls ae chose at adom without eplacemet.

(i)&bsp;&bsp;&bsp;&bsp; Copy ad complete the followig tee diagam.

(ii)&bsp;&bsp;&bsp; Fid the pobability that two white balls ae chose.

[5]
a(i) ad (ii).

Bag A cotais thee white balls ad fou ed balls. Two balls ae chose at adom without eplacemet.

Bag B cotais fou white balls ad thee ed balls. Whe two balls ae chose at adom without eplacemet fom bag B, the pobability that they ae both white is \(\fac{2}{7}\) .

A stadad die is olled. If 1 o 2 is obtaied, two balls ae chose without eplacemet fom bag A, othewise they ae chose fom bag B.

Fid the pobability that the two balls ae white.

&bsp;

[5]
b.

Bag A cotais thee white balls ad fou ed balls. Two balls ae chose at adom without eplacemet.

Bag B cotais fou white balls ad thee ed balls. Whe two balls ae chose at adom without eplacemet fom bag B, the pobability that they ae both white is&bsp;\(\fac{2}{7}\) .&bsp;

A stadad die is olled. If 1 o 2 is obtaied, two balls ae chose without eplacemet fom bag A, othewise they ae chose fom bag B.

Give that both balls ae white, fid the pobability that they wee chose fom bag A.

[4]
c.
markschems:
(i)


\(\frac{4}{6},\frac{3}{6}{\rm{and}}\frac{3}{6}\left( {\frac{2}{3},\frac{1}{2}{\rm{and}}\frac{1}{2}} \right)\)    A1A1A1     N3

(ii) multiplying along the correct branches (may be seen on diagram)     (A1)

e.g. \(\frac{3}{7} \times \frac{2}{6}\)

\(\frac{6}{{42}}\left( { = \frac{1}{7}} \right)\)     A1     N2

[5 marks]

a(i) and (ii).

\({\rm{P(bag A) = }}\frac{2}{6}\left( { = \frac{1}{3}} \right)\) , \({\rm{P(bag B) = }}\frac{4}{6}\left( { = \frac{2}{3}} \right)\) (seen anywhere)     (A1)(A1)

appropriate approach    (M1)

e.g. \({\rm{P(}}WW \cap A) + {\rm{P}}(WW \cap B)\)


correct calculation     A1

e.g. \(\frac{1}{3} \times \frac{1}{7} + \frac{2}{3} \times \frac{2}{7}\) , \(\frac{2}{{42}} + \frac{8}{{42}}\)

\({\rm{P}}(2W) = \frac{{60}}{{252}}\left( { = \frac{5}{{21}}} \right)\)    A1     N3

[5 marks]

b.

recognizing conditional probability     (M1)

e.g. \(\frac{{{\rm{P}}(A \cap B)}}{{{\rm{P}}(B)}}\) , \({\rm{P}}(A|WW) = \frac{{{\rm{P}}(WW \cap A)}}{{{\rm{P}}(WW)}}\)

correct numerator     (A1)

e.g. \({\rm{P}}(A \cap WW) = \frac{6}{{42}} \times \frac{2}{6},\frac{1}{{21}}\)

correct denominator     (A1)

e.g. \(\frac{6}{{252}},\frac{5}{{21}}\)

probability \(\frac{{84}}{{420}}\left( { = \frac{1}{5}} \right)\)    A1     N3

[4 marks]

c.
